definition.name: tofu-check
definition.description: Check if there are OpenTofu changes to apply
definition.author: Daniel Flook

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path to the OpenTofu root module to check

inputs.name: workspace
inputs.description: OpenTofu workspace to run the plan in

inputs.name: variables
inputs.description:
Variables to set for the tofu plan. This should be valid OpenTofu syntax - like a [variable definition file](https://opentofu.org/docs/language/values/variables/#variable-definitions-tfvars-files).

Variables set here override any given in `var_file`s.

inputs.name: var_file
inputs.description:
List of tfvars files to use, one per line.
Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace

inputs.name: backend_config
inputs.description: List of OpenTofu backend config values, one per line.

inputs.name: backend_config_file
inputs.description:
List of OpenTofu backend config files to use, one per line.
Paths should be relative to the GitHub Actions workspace

inputs.name: parallelism
inputs.description: Limit the number of concurrent operations

outputs.name: failure-reason
outputs.description:
When the job outcome is `failure` because the there are outstanding changes to apply, this will be set to 'changes-to-apply'.
If the job fails for any other reason this will not be set.
This can be used with the Actions expression syntax to conditionally run a step when there are changes to apply.
